title: News Feed - Free User
custom_preconds:
Given latest MLB is installed on an iPhone
and there is a News Feed

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on the News section
and observes the top header
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then user will see the following in the header:
MLB.TV icon
Segment Controller (MLB.com, Favorite Team, Teams)
Gameday Audio

custom_steps_separated.content:
When user When a user taps on the MLB button in the top center of the News page
and the Teams popover is displayed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be able to switch to another news index via the team picker

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on the Newsreader
and taps on the MLB.TV button on the top left hand corner
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the MLB.TV page will display

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on the Newsreader
and taps on the Audio button on the top right hand corner
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Paywall will display for Lite users
or the Audio page will display for Full users

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user pulls down the section below the Top Stories/Videos segmented controller
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then iOS pull to refresh will be exposed with circle animation (similar to native iOS Mail App) and the news section will refresh with the most current article in the index at top

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on the Newsreader
and taps on an article to open the article
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then that news article will open up
and a back button will display on the upper left of the article

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on a news article
and taps on the back button in the upper left of the article
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the article will slide from left to right
and you will be returned to the news index

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on a news article
and taps on the sharing button on the upper right
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the sharing popover displays the options for Message, Mail, Twitter, Facebook (depending what is on the iDevice)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on a news article
and taps on the font button on the upper right
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the font will become larger with each tap
and when you continue to tap until it gets to the maximum size then the next tap will cause the font to start from a small font

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on a news article
and you scroll to the right
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then a the next article will display
and the article number located in the top center of the news reader will change accordingly

(1 of 30, 2 of 30, 3 of 30)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is a Lite user
and selects the News menu
and is on the news index page
and taps the bottom banner on the main page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the expected webview for that banner will open

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user selects the News menu
and selects a News article
and scrolls up and down on the news article
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the scrolling goes up and down accordingly
and the scroll is smooth

custom_steps_separated.content: When lite user signed in AND ads display
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then ads should be appear in between news headlines for lite user

custom_steps_separated.content: When navigate to article
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then user able to see full article

title: News Refresh
custom_preconds:
Given an user is on an iOS Device with iOS At Bat installed

To test it would be easier to connect to Charles and filter by newsreader.json to see if calls files:

Prod - http://mlb.mlb.com/gen/content/tag/v1/mlb/news/ipad_newsreader.json
Prod - http://mlb.mlb.com/gen/content/tag/v1/mlb/news/iphone_newsreader.json

cacheLifetime set in seconds in the config (usually about 5 minutes):
https://atbatappconfig.mlb.com/ios/9.4.0/ipadOverrides.json
https://atbatappconfig.mlb.com/ios/9.4.0/iphoneOverrides.json

custom_steps_separated.content: when open app first time and tap on News
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the News index should refresh and load new

custom_steps_separated.content: When on News and uses pull to refresh
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the News index refresh and load new

custom_steps_separated.content:
When changes between News index and Video index less than 5 minutes

cacheLifetime does not expire
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the News index does not refresh, load cache

custom_steps_separated.content:
When changes between News index and Video index more than 5 minutes

cacheLifetime does expire
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then News index refresh when cache expires

custom_steps_separated.content:
When 	
sitting in the app for less than minutes and navigating back to News

cacheLifetime does not expire
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the News index does not refresh, load cache

custom_steps_separated.content:
When sitting in the app for 5 minutes and navigating back to News

cacheLifetime does expire
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the News index refresh and load new

custom_steps_separated.content:
When tap into an article and tap back to the index less than 5 minutes

cacheLifetime does not expire
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the News index does not refresh, load cache

custom_steps_separated.content:
When tap into an article and tap back to the index more than 5 minutes

cacheLifetime does expires
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the News index refresh and load new

title: Sharing
custom_preconds: Given an iPhone device with latest MLB app installed

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is in an article in full screen mode
and taps on the sharing button on the upper right
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the sharing popover displays the options for Message, Mail, Twitter, Facebook

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the Twitter button on the Share popover for an article
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a Twitter popover will appear for the user

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the Cancel button on the Twitter popover
custom_steps_separated.expected: When a user taps on the Cancel button on the Twitter popover

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the Post button on the Twitter popover for an article
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then we will see the Tweet successfully posted to Twitter

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user successfully sends a tweet from At Bat
and views the tweet in Twitter
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then we will see on Twitter that the end of the Tweet contains the following message:

"Sent with MLB.com At Bat mlb.com/r/article..."

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user successfully sends a tweet from At Bat for an article that pertains to a game summary
and views the tweet in T
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then we will see on Twitter that the end of the Tweet contains the following message:

"Sent with MLB.com At Bat mlb.com/mlb/gameday..."

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on Post on the Facebook popover to share a news article
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then we will see that the comment we posted has successfully posted to Facebook

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user shares a news article on Facebook
and checks Facebook
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then we will see at the end of the Facebook post that it contains: "MLB.com"

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user taps on the share button in the top right corner
and taps on the Mail button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the default iOS mail view will appear successfully

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has no e-mail setup on a iDevice
and taps to Mail button on Share popover for an article
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then we will be prompted with a message to set the account up in Mail Settings

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has e-mail setup on a iDevice
and taps to Mail button on Share popover for an article
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then we are able to successfully send an email
and the recipient is able to successfully receive the email
